availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Harrison K. Browder (Hopkins County, KY farm laborer and private 17th ky cav (usa()

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Isham Browder and Lucretia Browder. Student in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farm laborer in Hopkins County in 1860. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from January 3, 1865, to September 20, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 111B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 596.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0137.
"Harrison Key Browder (1841-1911)," Find A Grave, Memorial #68207324, accessed October 7, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/68207324.
